oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-page handwritten letter written from Ammons to his family recounting his attendance at the Bob Hope USO show on Christmas Eve in 1967. He describes being issued clean fatigues, flying on a Chinook helicopter to Lai Khe Base Camp, and viewing Hope with his customary golf club and girls. Back with the platoon, Chistmas Eve carols are interupted, but Christmas Day involves radio calls, packages, Santa in a Huey, the 1st Infantry Band, and Christmas lunch with the General.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
